item.title: Report E-2024100659
item.description:
Report E-2024100659

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-30T09:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-11
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 11, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon jug of NALCOÂ® 7330 was punctured by a nail and released approximately three (3) cups of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. A pH test was performed before remediation and a neutral reading was confirmed. The damaged pail was located and patched to prevent further release of product. Crews utilized rags to wipe down the impacted area to ensure cleaning. The damaged pail and all spent absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100629
item.description:
Report E-2024100629

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-27T18:24:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-11
  • City: ELYRIA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 11, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2586 was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized a 95-gallon open top drum to overpack and contain the damaged 55-gallon drum. Crews utilized a Hudson Sprayer, absorbent pads, and a neutralizing agent, to neutralize the accessible impacted areas. FCE personnel then deployed granular absorbents worked them in using hand tools. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100599
item.description:
Report E-2024100599

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-25T09:22:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/9/24, a drum from SD Myers was delivered to Veolia's ten-day in-transit facility and temporarily placed on the dock pending transfer to another trailer for final disposal. During the subsequent loading process for outbound transportation, facility personnel observed liquid on the floor near the drum's location. Upon investigation, it was discovered that a pinhole in the bottom chime of the drum had allowed its contents to leak. To address this issue, the following actions were taken: 1. The compromised drum was immediately overpacked to ensure safe continued transportation. 2. The affected concrete surface was thoroughly decontaminated in full compliance with the procedures outlined in 40 CFR Â§ 761.79(b)(4). These prompt actions ensured the containment of the spill, the safe handling of the drum, and the proper remediation of the affected area, all in accordance with applicable regulations and safety protocols.
